description.p: You owe your skills not just to your own abilities, but also to the weaknesses of your enemies. You know how to adapt to any situation, taking advantage of every opportunity to strike your enemies where it counts.

sheet.description: You owe your skills not just to your own abilities, but also to the weaknesses of your enemies.

description.p: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in improvised weapons, and improvised weapons have the finesse property for you.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in improvised weapons, and improvised weapons have the finesse property for you.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you know just how to bypass your enemy’s defenses and strike them where it hurts, throwing off their aim completely. When you deal damage with your Sneak Attack to a creature, you can force the target to make a weapon attack against another creature within its weapon’s range.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining expended uses whenever you complete a long rest.
Additionally, as long as it’s your turn, you gain a +5 bonus to your AC.

sheet.description: When you deal damage with your Sneak Attack to a creature, you can force the target to make a weapon attack against another creature within its weapon’s range. Additionally, as long as it’s your turn, you gain a +5 bonus to your AC.

description.p: When you reach 9th level, you know just how to come back from a failure, spinning it into something new. Whenever you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of your Dirty Fighting feature. If you do, you can reroll the check, but you must use the new result.

sheet.description: Whenever you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of your Dirty Fighting feature. If you do, you can reroll the check, but you must use the new result.

description.p: At 13th level, you know just how to read your enemies, predicting their next moves. Whenever a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

sheet.description: Whenever a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

description.p: By the time you reach 17th level, you have mastered your known arts. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Whenever you force a creature to make an attack roll with your Dirty Fighting feature, that creature gains advantage on its attack if you force it to target a creature hostile to you, and disadvantage if you force it to target you or a creature allied to you.
Whenever you make a weapon attack as a part of a reaction, you do so with advantage.

sheet.description: You gain the following benefits: • Whenever you force a creature to make an attack roll with your Dirty Fighting feature, that creature gains advantage on its attack if you force it to target a creature hostile to you, and disadvantage if you force it to target you or a creature allied to you. • Whenever you make a weapon attack as a part of a reaction, you do so with advantage.
